reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated some 500 meters from Seefeld center and close to a golf course. It is a typical Austrian building, which has been extended several times.
reviews.title: Typical Austrian atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room and bathroom were very spacious, clean and well equipped.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really loved the spa and sauna area with a variety of facilities, including an outdoor swimming pool and perfect massage.
reviews.title: Perfect Austrian Christmas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was good and friendly.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All guests had a reserved, fixed table in the restaurant for breakfast and dinner. Most guests were elderly couples and I mean really elderly (mainly over 65).
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was our third visit to this hotel as part of our summer break as independent travellers in various countries in Europe. The hotel is a five minute walk from the centre of Seefeld in a quiet, ideal location. Our room (206) with a balcony was spacious and had good views. All public areas were clean and well kept and the staff were extremely helpful. We had the gourmet food package which in effect is dinner, lunch, bed and breakfast. Lunch is self service and can be taken any time from one until four in the afternoon.There is an outdoor eco pool and an indoor pool both of which are of a reasonable size. We didn't use the spa but it looked tempting! During our holiday, we walked in the mountains and the surrounding villages and using the bus/train transport systems is relatively easy. The hotel is very good value for money.
reviews.title: Third Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: We've recently returned from a week here and had only one day of rain which is great for the mountains and excellent for walking. The hotel is located almost opposite the golf academy and it's an easy, short stroll into town.
reviews.title: A really nice hotel but a tad too hot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The reception staff were excellent all week, happy to help whenever asked.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Excellent Facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid extra through Crystal for a recent room in what I think they class as the Residence wing which appears to be a relatively new addition at the back and to the side of the main building.
reviews.title: Almost perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was a slightly odd shape with what seemed to be the eaves intruding between the windows on the left and the balcony doors on the right. They had squeezed a 2 seater couch and table into this space which felt a rad claustrophobic.
reviews.title: a good hotel with lovely staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 2 week holiday at the Hotel Schoenruh. We had booked the Hotel Stephanie via Inghams but were upgraded to the Schoenruh. We had a balcony and a nice view of the mountains, although the room was a little smaller than we would have liked, but as we were upgraded can't complain.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great facilities and excellent food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is ideally situated in a quiet part of Seefeld near the gold course and just a flatish walk to the town centre. The hotel had indoor and outdoor pools, whirlpool, gym, saunas etc. and the wellness centre and free bike hire. Throughout the week various walks and excursions were organised.
reviews.title: Relaxing break with good food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is excellent. Hot and cold breakfast, plenty of choice. Our deal included packed lunch or buffet between 1 and 4pm. The buffet consisted of various salads, rolls and bread soup and always 1 hot dish (lasagne, various pasta dishes, chicken wings, sausages, etc.) As the hot dish was emptied it was replenished as was the cake selection. Dinner was amazing and usually consisted of 5 courses (7 courses one night). Choice of 2 starters, 2 soups, salad buffet, choice of about 5 main courses and 2 desserts. Once a week a buffet starter (over 30 dishes to choose from), another day a dessert buffet was equally impressive. The quality was excellent throughout.
reviews.title: High Standard of hotel but one for the oldies"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The other guests were mainly German and for the first few days we did not come across any other British guests.
reviews.title: great hotel - want to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would stay here again but only if we had a larger room plus a good view,
reviews.title: Tyrolean Spa and Week Long Cross Country Ski Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Firstly can i say that as a very regular traveler around Europe and having stayed in many good quality Hotels. this is the first time i have ever felt the need to write a review on this site. We arrived at the hotel by car on New Year's eve, I had some difficulty accessing the hotel as cars were parked right up to the front steps. On enquiry I was told that there was nowhere to park, however after some conversation a place was found for us in the underground car park, at a cost of 4 euro’s per night. We were then taken to our rooms, my husband and I were in room number 255, my daughter 253. Beware that the hotel seems to change the room numbers though. Entering the room I felt I was stepping back 25 years or so, the decor was very outdated with old furnishings, old fashioned wall paper, in places leaving the walls. The guilt edged pictures, rusty radiator, old chair, a mirrored fridge which also served as the t.v. stand, a bathroom 20 years out of date, complete with cracked sink, was not what I expected to find in an Austrian hotel of this class. The bedroom and bathroom were also very small. After taking a shower I stepped into the bedroom to get dry as there was not enough room in the bathroom, I am 5' 6" and 11 stone! After complaining at reception we were told we had only booked a 'superior double, which is what we had been given, to call these rooms superior is a gross exaggeration. My daughter's room 253 was as bad. My son who was flying in was given a room at the other side of the hotel, it may as well have been another hotel, his beautifully furnished room (108) was a world away from the shabby rooms in the older part of the hotel. Things however were about to get a whole lot worse when around 1am on New Year's day we went to bed, room 255 is directly over the kitchen, which seems to run on trolleys which were pushed around most of the night, access to the kitchen is through a sliding door, again underneath room 255. These rooms should not be let out, certainly not for Schoenruh prices, they are old fashioned shabby noisy rooms that should not be in use, the sheets were well worn and in parts developing holes, the small towels again were well worn, together with the bath robes.
reviews.title: New Year at the Hotel Schoenruh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: After two sleepless night we were able to up-grade to another room, for another 32 euro's per night we were given a beautifully decorated room, with a large walk in shower, a large bed and everything you would expect from a 4 star Austrian hotel.
reviews.title: My new favourite place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On New Year's eve there were more people booked into the hotel than the staff could cater for, we waited for an hour between courses, at which point we gave in and went to the bar. The gala dinner we were told was formal dress, after buying my son a dinner suit I wasn't impressed to see some people in jeans, cords and polo's. So if you are planning a new year break at this hotel don't bother with the 'formal' dress code.
reviews.title: want to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At some point on new years eve a broken glass and tissues were put into one of the Christmas decorations at the front of the hotel, it was still there three days later. Knowing what a good internet service there is in Austria I was surprised that I had to pay 1 euro for 10 minutes use.
reviews.title: Excellent but odd.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately my son's flight was diverted because of heavy snow, so after eating during the morning at Manchester airport he was rather hungry by the time he arrived at the hotel at 11.15pm. It took me three attempts to get him some food.
reviews.title: Surpassed expectations - a lovely stay
